{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3169915,"name":"John","username":"JelloAxolotl","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/f6c823/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-03-22T00:13:02.396Z","cooked":"

Just updated one of my vendor libraries to the latest version and it caused a strange error:

  • Where:
    Build file ‘C:\Users\burnhamjf\Documents\Robot23JB\build.gradle’ line: 3

  • What went wrong:
    An exception occurred applying plugin request [id: ‘edu.wpi.first.GradleRIO’, version: ‘2023.4.2’]

Failed to apply plugin class ‘edu.wpi.first.gradlerio.wpi.WPIPlugin’.
Could not create an instance of type edu.wpi.first.gradlerio.wpi.WPIExtension.
Failed to apply plugin class ‘edu.wpi.first.nativeutils.vendordeps.WPIVendorDepsPlugin’.
Could not create an instance of type edu.wpi.first.nativeutils.vendordeps.WPIVendorDepsExtension.
java.lang.NullPointerException (no error message)

What library? How did you update it?

Can you post the output of the WPILib: Open Project Information in VS Code?

It’s our team’s personal Library that was updated. The update works just fine on my mentor’s computer but not on mine.

Also here’s the Project Information:

WPILib Information:
Project Version: 2023.4.2
VS Code Version: 1.74.2
WPILib Extension Version: 2023.1.1
C++ Extension Version: 1.13.8
Java Extension Version: 1.13.0
Java Debug Extension Version: 0.47.0
Java Dependencies Extension Version 0.21.1
Java Version: 17
Java Location: C:\Users\Public\wpilib\2023\jdk
Vendor Libraries:
KauaiLabs_navX_FRC (2023.1.0)
PathplannerLib (2023.4.3)
CTRE-Phoenix (v5) (5.30.2)
photonlib (v2023.4.2)
REVLib (2023.1.3)
ORF-4450-RobotLib (4.4.0)
WPILib-New-Commands (1.0.0)

One potential problem is that you haven’t used the WPILIb installer to update to version 2023.4.2
